articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: CDC ramps up response to coronavirus
articles.description: There are new cases of coronavirus being reported. The CDC is ramping up its response to the epidemic by setting up five labs around the country. Carter Evans has the latest.

articles.author: christina capatides
articles.title: Bullies attack Asian American teen, citing coronavirus
articles.description: Because the coronavirus outbreak started in China, some misguided individuals are targeting Asians with discriminatory behavior or worse.
articles.content: A 16-year-old boy in California's San Fernando Valley was physically attacked this week by bullies in his high school who accused him of having the coronavirus — simply because he is Asian American. It is just the latest episode in a spree of racist incidents… [+3402 chars]

articles.author: Sophie Lewis
articles.title: U.S. couple celebrates Valentine's Day on coronavirus ship
articles.description: Matthew Smith and his wife Katherine Codekas have lived onboard Carnival's Diamond Princess Cruise ship for nearly a month — but that hasn't stopped them from partaking in some Valentine's Day activities.
articles.content: For almost a month, Matthew Smith and his wife Katherine Codekas have been aboard Carnival's Diamond Princess Cruise ship. But they haven't been enjoying a romantic extended vacation — they've been quarantined because of a coronavirus outbreak on the vessel. … [+3692 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: CDC braces for a long fight as coronavirus toll mounts in China
articles.description: The death toll is nearing 1,400, but global health officials say a massive spike in Chinese cases isn't necessarily the "tip of an iceberg."
articles.content: The head of the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says the new coronavirus, which has killed almost 1,400 people and is still spreading in China, could be around for at least another year. With the Chinese government reporting 121 more deaths an… [+1542 chars]

articles.title: California student stuck in China during coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: Samson Adame, a 24-year-old Cal State Northridge student, has been in the Shandong Province of China since the coronavirus epidemic broke out.
articles.content:
A Cal State University Northridge student is still in China on Thursday night, near the epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak — his semester studying abroad turning into a health care nightmare, CBS Los Angeles reported.
